detaileddescription.para: Blending equations that can be used when rendering.
Blending colors
Blending equations
Blending Equation Color
Blend functions which help determine the type of blending that's applied to a renderable object.
Blending Function Color
This enumeration outlines the basic types of buffers are available for use in a render context. It will be updated as more features are written.
Different usage parameters that determine how a buffer may be used.
Memory mapping bit flags used for DMA transfers between CPU and GPU memory.
These enumerations are used to specify the basic data type each pixel of a texture or framebuffer.
OpenGL refers to these as the "format" parameter when using operations such as "glTexImage()."
OpenGL refers to these types as the "internalFormat" parameter in functions such as "glRenderbufferStorage()" and "glTexImage()"
These can be sent to OpenGL in order to determine how to compare the depth of rasterized fragments.
Display in standard fullscreen
Display a borderless window at the current display's full resolution.
Currently uses a standard full-screen mode.
These flags can be used to determine the full-screen mode of a display object.

para.heading: Draw buffers for fbo render targets
Texture targets that can be bound to an FBO
Draw/Read access control for framebuffer objects.

detaileddescription.para: Bitmasks that can help determine what aspects of a framebuffer should be modified during read/draw calls.

para.heading: Enumeration to facilitate matrix manipulations within the matrix stack.

detaileddescription.para: These enumerations contains properties for different types of mesh objects. These constants used within contain vital information that's used within the mesh object's implementation.

briefdescription.para: Winding order for polygons. This also helps determine which faces won't be rendered if face culling is enabled.

detaileddescription.para: Display tests

para.heading: Enumeration to determine the type of shader that should be created on the GPU
Parameters for creating or modifying texture objects.

detaileddescription.para: These enumerations can be used to describe vertex layouts to VAO objects.
Print SDL window flags to the console. This is primarily used for debugging.

parameterdescription.para: A bit field of difference SDL flags., see https://wiki.libsdl.org/ for more information.

para.heading: Helper function to load a glyph

detaileddescription.para: Simple helper function that can help reduce a few lines of code during texture initialization.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the texture was created properly, FALSE if not.
